children.value: Launches a browser with a tab. The browser will be closed when the parent node.js process is closed.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
openBrowser()
openBrowser({ headless: false })
openBrowser({args:['--window-size=1440,900']})
openBrowser({args: [
     '--disable-gpu',
      '--disable-dev-shm-usage',
      '--disable-setuid-sandbox',
      '--no-first-run',
      '--no-sandbox',
      '--no-zygote']}) - These are recommended args that has to be passed when running in docker

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to open browser in headless/headful mode.
tags.name: options.headless

tags.title: param
tags.description: Remote debugging port if not given connects to any open port.
tags.name: options.port

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to run commands with delay to observe what's happening.
tags.name: options.observe

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to modify delay time for observe mode.
tags.name: options.observeTime

tags.title: param
tags.description: Option to dump IO from browser
tags.name: options.dumpio

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Object with the description of the action performed.

      '--disable-dev-shm-usage',
      '--disable-setuid-sandbox',
      '--no-first-run',
      '--no-sandbox',
      '--no-zygote']}) - These are recommended args that has to be passed when running in docker

Add interceptor for the network call to override request or mock response.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
case 1: block url => intercept(url)
case 2: mockResponse => intercept(url,{mockObject})
case 3: override request => intercept(url,(request) => {request.continue({overrideObject})})
case 4: redirect => intercept(url,redirectUrl)
case 5: mockResponse based on request => intercept(url,(request) => { request.respond({mockResponseObject})} )

tags.title: param
tags.description: action to be done after interception. For more examples refer to https://github.com/getgauge/taiko/issues/98#issuecomment-42024186
tags.name: option

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Object with the description of the action performed.

Fetches an element with the given selector, scrolls it into view if needed, and then clicks in the center of the element. If there's no element matching selector, the method throws an error.

tags.description: wait for navigation to start. Default to 500ms
tags.name: options.waitForStart

tags.title: param
tags.description: Timeout value in milliseconds for navigation after click.
tags.name: options.timeout

tags.title: param
tags.description: Number of times to click on the element.
tags.name: options.clickCount

tags.title: param
tags.description: Number of elements to loop through to match the element with given selector.
tags.name: options.elementsToMatch

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Object with the description of the action performed.
